headline.print_headline: Citing Logistics, F.T.C. Pushes Antitrust Inquiry Against Google Into January
headline.seo: F.T.C. Pushes Antitrust Inquiry Against Google Into January
headline.main: Citing Logistics, F.T.C. Pushes Antitrust Inquiry Against Google Into January

docs.snippet: The delay in an agreement between the Federal Trade Commission and the company is said to have put stronger penalties back on the bargaining table....
docs.abstract: Federal Trade Commission delays agreement to settle its antitrust dispute with Google, move that is said to put stronger penalties back on the bargaining table.

byline.original: By EDWARD WYATT and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER
byline.contributor: Edward Wyatt reported from Washington and Claire Cain Miller from San Francisco.

docs.lead_paragraph: The delay in an agreement between the Federal Trade Commission and the company is said to have put stronger penalties back on the bargaining table.

headline.main: Behind the Scenes in Congress; Out in Front at Home

docs.snippet: Steve Stombres, the chief of staff to the House majority, is one of very few people in Washington who is both a senior Capitol Hill staff member and a local elected official....
docs.abstract: Steve Stombers, chief of staff to House Majority Leader Eric Cantor, is also a member of the Fairfax City Council in Virginia, making him one of the only people in Washington to hold two such positions.
docs.lead_paragraph: Steve Stombres, the chief of staff to the House majority, is one of very few people in Washington who is both a senior Capitol Hill staff member and a local elected official.

headline.print_headline: Yemeni Leader Tries to Centralize a Divided Military
headline.seo: Yemeni Leader, Hadi, Shakes Up a Divided Military
headline.main: Yemeni Leader Tries to Centralize a Divided Military

docs.snippet: The reshuffling of the military was seen as a crucial component of Yemen’s transition after the autocratic rule of Ali Abdullah Saleh, the predecessor of President Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Yemeni Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi orders sweeping restructuring of country’s divided and weak military, moving to replace or sideline commanders who were loyal to his predecessor and whose competing agendas have fed country’s persistent insecurity.

byline.contributor: Nasser Arrabyee contributed reporting from Sana, Yemen.

docs.lead_paragraph: The reshuffling of the military was seen as a crucial component of Yemen’s transition after the autocratic rule of Ali Abdullah Saleh, the predecessor of President Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi.

headline.print_headline: Lessons in Politics and Fine Print In Assault Weapons Ban of ’90s
headline.main: Lessons in Politics and Fine Print in Assault Weapons Ban of ’90s

docs.snippet: After a 1989 schoolyard shooting, it took five years of legislative slogging to pass a federal assault weapons ban. But the price of passage was a host of compromises....

keywords.value: Brady Campaign to Prevent Gun Violence
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Assault weapons ban passed in 1990s offers lessons for those who are calling for similar ban in wake of Newtown, Conn, shooting; most difficult terrain to navigate will most likely be political, as any new federal measure would have to overcome opposition of pro-gun lawmakers and gun lobby, but contours of policy will be nettlesome as well.

byline.original: By MICHAEL LUO and MICHAEL COOPER

docs.lead_paragraph: After a 1989 schoolyard shooting, it took five years of legislative slogging to pass a federal assault weapons ban. But the price of passage was a host of compromises.
